intro: Bunium macuca var. abylaeum, commonly known as the alpine fennel, is a perennial herb native to high-altitude regions of the European Alps. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to yellowish flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous climates. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for ecological studies and conservation efforts.
